page.title: 05LANDSCAPE
page.content: The dominant land cover in all twelve grid squares is intensively managed grassland. In total it makes up approximately 75% of the total area and is probably a response to the relatively high rainfall experienced by this area, about l,000 mm per year. This grassland occupies both the tops of the small hills and the valley sides but on the floors of the small river valleys deciduous woodland is very common. Arable crops occupy only about 5% of the area and barely appears to be the most common. On the increase at the present time is land devoted to transport as the new road linking the proposed bridge over the Torridge with North Cornwall, runs across the northwest corner of this area.
